intro: Erigeron cabrerae, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It features narrow, silvery-gray leaves and produces blue to purple ray flowers that attract pollinators. Erigeron cabrerae is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
